Metaphysics refers to the study of problems that cannot be directly answered through sensory experience alone through rational reasoning and logic.
Phenomenology is a basic principle of philosophy, aimed at explaining the fundamental nature of existence and the world.

The Chinese term "形而上学" is derived from the ancient Chinese classic "易经•系辞上传", which means "the way of metaphysics" or "the study of the ultimate reality". This term was later translated into Japanese by the philosopher 井上哲次郎 (Mitsuyo Abe) in the Meiji period, from the Greek word "metaphysics".
Metaphysics, natural theology, and related issues are included in this branch.
The basic point is to investigate which words represent real existing entities and which words only represent concepts.
Naturalism in philosophy, denying the existence of God.
According to its theoretical basis, all phenomena can be explained by natural reasons, and this idea was proposed by philosophers who support scientific and evolutionary theories.
The method of naturalism, which does not place a single word from God, is a research method.
Philosophy of mind is a branch of philosophy that studies the nature of consciousness and its relationship with the body (particularly the brain).
The two schools of thought, dualism and monism, are the main schools of thought in discussing the relationship between the mind and the body.
Epistemology is a branch of philosophy that explores the nature, origin, and scope of knowledge.
Moral science is a systematic and comprehensive study of human ethical life, where morality is defined as the collectively recognized standards of behavior of a group of people or a culture.

Mainly divided into moral philosophy (abstractly studying moral theories or critically examining their essence) and ethical norms (judging various moral views and providing ethical standards for correct or incorrect behavior).

It researches how people should adhere to moral standards, applies ethics (the application of ethical theories to real-life situations, including biopolitics and political ethics), and describes ethics (collects information on how people live and draws conclusions based on observations).

It does not evaluate ethics from preconceived theoretical assumptions, but rather examines the actual choices made by moral agents (individuals or groups) and the factors that influence those choices, which are observed and studied, and lead to the formation of ethical principles held by social groups.
Moral philosophy includes Greek and Roman moral philosophy, as well as medieval Christian moral philosophy.
The first part: Humanistic moral philosophy, represented by Valla and Montaigne.
Part Two: The Ethical Thought of the Religious Reformation, Represented by Calvin.

China's Sand Sculpture Artists Hold First Contemporary Art Biennale - Xinhua Net

Xinhua News Agency, December 12th (Reporter Wang Haiqiong) - The first contemporary art biennial exhibition in Saudi Arabia, the "Darryl JAX Art Biennale," opened to the public on December 11th in the northwestern part of Riyadh, the capital of Saudi Arabia. A total of 64 artists from Saudi Arabia, China, and other regions are participating in the exhibition.
This biannual exhibition is jointly planned by the Saudi Arabia Uridor Foundation and the UCCA Dune Center in China, with UCCA Dune Center director Tian Yunyu serving as the art director.

According to the exhibition team, the theme of this biennial exhibition is "Crossing the River by Feeling the Stones," which represents the reform strategies taken during the period of social economic transformation in Saudi Arabia, and reflects the current state of cultural development in the society.

This year's dual-annual exhibition covers an area of nearly 12,000 square meters, with six interconnected buildings presenting six themes: "Touching the Stone Bridge," "Inheriting as an Experiment," "Edge of Thought," "Reaching the Public," "Beautiful New World," and "On the Spirit of Art."

Among the 27 Saudi artists whose works are on display, their number accounts for over four-fifths of the total number of works; they are mainly focused on painting, installation art, and performance art. Similarly, 12 Chinese artists are also well-received, some of whom have employed innovative methods in using recycled materials for their creations, such as Xu Bing's "River Series: Infinite Mountain Landscape" (2014), which reconstructs a classic mountain landscape using discarded objects.

The CEO of the Dali International Art Festival, Bakli, expressed the hope that this year's festival will establish an international dialogue, providing global audiences with an opportunity to learn about the cultural and creative industry of Saudi Arabia and the vibrant art community, and strengthening exchanges between the two sides.

Tan Yu said, "The goal of the biennial is double-edged, allowing Saudi contemporary art to participate in the global conversation while also allowing Saudi audiences to immerse themselves in the contemporary art world."

According to what I understand, during the two-week period of the exhibition, there will be a series of lectures held, where artists, curators, and leaders of the creative industry will discuss topics such as cross-cultural exchange, contemporary art development, etc.

Yunnan: Coordinated Standardization of Village-Level Public Service Positions - Xinhua Net

According to Xinhua News Agency in Kunming on December 12th (reporter Lin Bifeng), to continue to do well in poverty alleviation through employment and job training, to consolidate and expand the achievements of poverty reduction, Yunnan Province has recently introduced policies to promote rural revitalization and improve rural public services, which will help to comprehensively promote rural revitalization.

The Yunnan Provincial People's Government has introduced relevant responsible persons to introduce that, currently, Yunnan has developed 44.83 million rural public service positions, which are used to place poverty-stricken laborers and other rural difficult groups in employment, and play an important role in helping these groups achieve income increases, consolidate the achievements of poverty reduction, and improve the overall ability of rural public services.

This new regulation, issued by the seven departments of Yunnan Province, including the Department of Human Resources, Rural Revitalization, Finance, and so on, mainly regulates the scope of recruitment for rural public positions, financial management, position development, and position management.

In terms of job setting, the new regulations are clear and specific, and are based on the principles of "assignment based on needs, with each person responsible for their own work, dynamic management, and total control of quantities." The principles are "who develops, who uses, who is responsible, and one person, one job, voluntary disclosure, and unified management."
The recruitment process must follow the steps of advertising, application, screening, notification, hiring, training, and arrangement.

In addition, the new regulations have clearly defined the specific responsibilities of the rural public service positions development department, the standards for supplementing rural public service positions, and the methods for supplementing them. The regulations require each rural public service position development department to purchase commercial insurance for unexpected injuries to rural public service position employees. Additionally, relevant departments are required to periodically monitor the situation regarding supplementary payments for rural public service positions.

The US has been suppressing China's chip industry by requiring its own companies and allied firms to simultaneously embargo China's chip industry, leading to a decline in orders and profits for global chip suppliers, resulting in reduced research and development investment and production capacity, and ultimately causing disruptions in the global chip supply chain.

The shortage of chips has already affected various industries globally, including automakers halting production, smartphone prices surging, and almost all industries that use chips being severely impacted.
To gain control over "chip" self-sufficiency, an increasing number of countries' tech giants are embarking on the "de-Americanization" path.

To tightly control the global semiconductor industry, to suppress the development of China's semiconductor industry, there have been frequent actions by the US recently, such as hosting the "Chip Summit" and inviting 64 major players from around the world to form a semiconductor alliance. Additionally, they have provided financial support to American domestic technology giants, such as Intel, to regain their leading position in the chip industry, with an investment of $200 billion in building two fabs in Arizona, and opening up chip manufacturing business to foreign companies.
Most people believe that Intel's actions will have a certain impact on Taiwan's semiconductor industry and may even grab a share of Taiwan's "lunch."

Intel, as a veteran technology giant in the semiconductor industry, has been cultivating a large pool of talent and technical resources for several decades, which enables it to quickly rise to the challenge and defeat Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) in the short term.
However, regarding Intel's decision, Zhang Tianxia, the founder of TSMC, did not give a damn.
At the "2021 Great Teacher Forum" held in April, Zhang Zongxun's remarks were shocking, as he spoke without hesitation about Intel's investment in the Lens Technology Plant, saying it was a mockery.
Zhang Zongxian's disdain for Intel's entry into the semiconductor field is due to his long-standing grudge against Taiwan Semiconductor, which dates back to over 30 years ago.
In the 1960s and 1970s, Intel was a shining gem in the US semiconductor industry, reigning supreme as the global leader in the field of semiconductors.
Until the 1980s, high-end semiconductors were monopolized by a few powerful players.

At that time, the semiconductor industry was characterized by IDM (Integrated Device Manufacturing) mode, where chip design, manufacturing, and testing were all done by a single factory, and Intel was a representative of that era.
However, this model makes it difficult for some small enterprises to bear, and many semiconductor entrepreneurs face huge investment costs for building production lines with only despairing steps.

Under the stimulus of market demand in the 1980s, the chip industry began to exhibit a trend of outsourcing and cooperation, and in 1984, Zhang Zongmou heard that there was a company specializing in chip design, so he thought, "If there is a company specializing in design, then we can establish a factory solely for manufacturing chips."
Not long after, Zhang Zongxun's idea became a reality, and the Taihang Electric Company was born.
TSMC focuses its main business on "precision processing" (i.e., lithography) and does not provide design services, only offering contract manufacturing services for lithography.
At that time, the newly established Taiwan Semiconductor, in front of Intel's giant, was just a small ant.

To secure capital support, Zhang Zongxian had previously sought investment from Intel, but when Intel heard that Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) only manufactured chip industry segments, they were clearly arrogant and looked down upon TSMC, and thus decisively rejected any investment from TSMC.
Zhang Zongwu also recognized that Intel at the time was not paying attention to the Jingdian manufacturing process.
I didn't expect to see the big shot who used to produce crystals, now starting to do contract work for crystals.
So, Zhang Zongxue felt that Intel's entry into the LCD panel industry was very ironic.
Currently, the market value of Taiwan's semiconductor industry has surpassed Intel.
Facing the intense offensive of Taiwan's electricity, Intel is also not willing to be cornered.
Currently, TSMC has already pushed towards 3nm chips, while Intel is still stuck at 7 years ago's 14nm.
It's not easy to catch up with someone who is ahead.

What is abnormal public opinion?

Here are six random selected search results for the same event, presented in the form of [peak shape], [tooth shape], and [cliff shape]:

1. Peak shape: 孤峰状 (lone peak)
Search result: 事故发生后，救护车才到达现场 (After the accident, the ambulance only arrived at the scene)
2. Tooth shape: 锯齿状 (jagged tooth)
Search result: 事故现场留下痕迹 (The accident left a trace)
3. Cliff shape: 断崖状 (cliff edge)
Search result: 救护车驶向事故现场 (The ambulance rushed to the accident scene)
4. Peak shape: 孤峰状 (lone peak)
Search result: 事故发生后，救护车才到达现场 (After the accident, the ambulance only arrived at the scene)
5. Tooth shape: 锯齿状 (jagged tooth)
Search result: 事故现场留下痕迹 (The accident left a trace)
6. Cliff shape: 断崖状 (cliff edge)
Search result: 救护车驶向事故现场 (The ambulance rushed to the accident scene)

Here are the translations of the three Chinese idioms:

【孤峰状】 (loneliness peak) - "to reach the peak of popularity" or "to become trendy"

例如：The new restaurant has reached the peak of popularity after being featured on social media.

【锯齿状】 (scissors-like) - "periodic heating" or "cyclical popularity"

例如：The fashion brand experiences a periodic surge in popularity every season.

【断崖状】 (cliff-like) - "mass withdrawal" or "collective departure"

例如：The social media platform lost popularity after the latest update.
In Figure 9, the peak of one event coincides with the trough of another event, with no time difference, and it is definitely a unified assault by the task force.

The professionalization of black PR can be seen clearly: several dozen hot searches simultaneously climbing the charts, which ones attract attention, which ones are responsible for propaganda, which ones create controversy, which ones shift the focus of attention, which ones influence cognition, which ones lead to misjudgments, which ones incite emotions, which ones manipulate decisions, and which ones are used to cover up the truth. The black PR accounts are divided into batches and fine-tuned at different nodes, almost considering all the elements of the public opinion transmission and diffusion process.
Journalism is a science that sets aside subjective opinions and emotions, and only relies on objective data. Even a black cat can't escape its shadow.
Every step leaves a trace, and we dig them up together.

"Comet to Bring Spectacular Meteor Shower for 14 Days - Xinhua Net"

Note: "新华网" is "Xinhua Net" in English.

According to a report by Xinhua News Agency on December 12th (reporter Zhou Rui), astronomy experts introduced that as the last and most massive meteor shower of the year, the Geminid meteor shower, which is one of the three major meteor showers in the northern hemisphere, will arrive on December 14th, and fans of meteor showers can observe it after midnight on that day.
The astronomer An Yue from Beijing captured the Geminid meteor shower on December 13, 2018, in Qinghai.
Most of the meteor showers' parent bodies are periodic comets, but the parent body of the Perseid meteor shower is 3200 Phaethon, which is an Apollo-type asteroid.
The twin star meteor shower is not the second meteor shower produced by a comet, but rather a meteor shower produced by a binary star system.

The Tianjin Astronomical Society vice president and astronomy expert Zhang Jie introduced, similar to the annual meteor shower, the Geminid meteor shower will appear in late December, with a display period from December 4th to 17th.

This comet rain is characterized by its large and stable flow, and is often referred to as one of the three major meteor showers in the Northern Hemisphere, along with the Perseid meteor shower and the Geminid meteor shower.

The significant feature of the Geminid meteor shower is that the meteoroids have slower speeds, rich colors, and numerous fireballs, making it suitable for both observing and photographing by beginner astronomers.
Yang Yi, an astronomy enthusiast from Tianjin, captured the Geminid meteor shower on December 13, 2020, in Tianjin, China.

According to the astronomical forecast, the Geminid meteor shower will arrive at 15:00 on December 14th this year, with a maximum ZHR (the number of meteors visible per hour under ideal observation conditions, with the radiant point located directly above the observer's head) of 150.
Twin Star Rain Recommended Index Chart.

Last year, the "Falling Star Show" of the twin star constellation left a deep impression on people, but this year's "Falling Star Show" will be affected by the moonlight and the level of beauty will be slightly reduced.

November 11th is the 11th day of the lunar calendar, and the moon is in the stage of being full and bright. The moonlight will interfere with the observation, but fortunately, the moon will set in the late night, and at that time, the radiant point of the Gemini meteor shower will rise higher.
Friends who like meteor showers can observe them during the few hours after moonset in the latter half of the night, but they should take precautions against the cold.
How can we observe more shooting stars?

"It's not recommended to observe the moon in the city, as there are too many light sources and it's difficult to get a clear view. Instead, head to a rural area with a high elevation, minimal light pollution, and an eastern directional view. After the moon has set, you can observe it patiently."
It is important to note that the flow of comets in the constellation of Gemini is in all directions and observing them without staring at their radiation point is recommended.
Friends who love photography want to capture stunning "flower rain" shots, so they should choose a wide-angle lens with a large aperture, and take photos using high ISO and the maximum aperture.
Based on stability and continuity considerations, the tripod, spare battery, and quick-release plate are also indispensable.

Laser TV and traditional TV have what differences in market positioning?
Based on my understanding, the term "traditional TV" used by the host refers to LCD TVs, and the main differences between LCD TVs and LED TVs in terms of market positioning are as follows:
The first is to focus on large screen market with laser TV.

Comparing the liquid crystal TV market positioning to the whole-home coverage of LED TVs, LED TVs are more focused on the large-screen market, or you could say that LED TVs themselves are a product tailored for the large-screen market.

Currently, the mainstream liquid crystal TV sizes are mainly in the range of 55 to 65 inches, while LED TVs generally have sizes ranging from 75 inches and above, with the largest sizes exceeding 100 inches, fully meeting users' demands for large-screen color TVs.
In recent years, the export and sales volume of LED TVs have been increasing rapidly globally, accounting for over six percent of the total TV sales market of 80 inches or larger.
According to Cao's forecast, the laser TV market sales in 2020 will exceed 140%, continuing to maintain high growth.
The reason why there are such excellent results in the large screen market is mainly due to the outstanding performance of laser TVs in eye protection.

Based on the principle of light reflection imaging, the light source emits light rays that do not directly enter the eye, compared to the backlight of liquid crystal televisions, the imaging process is closer to the natural conditions of object imaging, and the stimulation to the eyes is also smaller.

The State Electronic Technology Standardization Research Institute, West Experiment Room and the Ophthalmology Department of Beijing Union Medical College conducted a strict comparison test of liquid crystal TVs and plasma TVs under the same viewing conditions, resulting in 144 sets of test data.
Data confirms: Laser TVs do have strong protective effects on the eyes, and in some aspects, they even have a certain improving effect.

In the current era where visual health is becoming increasingly important, LED TVs have not only attracted more and more users with their protective advantages, but have also opened up a new breakthrough in the market for color TVs.
The second is to focus on high-end markets with laser TVs.

The prices of liquid crystal TVs and LED TVs are constantly inversely related, with the current market price of large-size LED TVs mostly above 10,000 yuan, and the price gradually increases as the screen size and light source are upgraded.
Why is the laser TV so expensive?
Certainly there is logic to it.
With the continuous development of light sources and technology, LED TVs and projection TVs have many advantages that cannot be achieved by liquid crystal TVs.

By leveraging super-short focus technology, laser TVs can project a 100-inch screen experience from a much shorter distance than traditional projection equipment, with a smaller space requirement and a more compact main unit.
The high-end brand LED TV can achieve a luminance of over 2000 nits.
Adding that the heat dissipation is lower, the device's lifespan is longer, and the TV's lifespan is also longer.

Except for that, many high-end laser TV models also come equipped with 4K ultra-high-definition picture quality, artificial intelligence systems, and other cutting-edge technologies, which can provide users with an even more impressive visual and audio experience.

Don't talk about fake needs, but rather focus on the specific products that meet those needs. Discuss the quality of the product and the input-output ratio, and don't be fooled by the name "laser TV" as it's not suitable for audio-visual enthusiasts who value large screens and comfortable viewing environments. It's important to weigh the pros and cons and make a decision based on personal judgment, rather than blindly following others' opinions.
Simply put, the super wide-angle and close-up lens used in the laser TV is not in line with the best optical design, as it is too expensive.
To filter out some environmental light, use a micro-structured Fresnel screen, which is expensive, with a price of around 80 inches equivalent to that of a 65-inch liquid crystal display.

There's something else, I particularly dislike the way some optical manufacturers market their products by claiming that the light reflected off the screen is like direct light, but in reality, it's not. For example, when light is reflected off the ceiling, you can't see it, even with the brightest TV. It's like the light is being "directly" transmitted to the ceiling, but you can't see it.
And, if the projection screen is not a random reflection, it cannot become an image.
The neglect of the high-contrast grating filter's glare effect resulted in a large amount of light reflection at a certain angle, making it extremely uncomfortable to look at.

Is buying a small umbrella insurance reliable?
Little umbrella is an internet-based insurance brokerage platform.

According to the regulations in the "Insurance Agency Institution Supervision Regulations (2015 Revision)", to establish an insurance agency company, the following three key terms must be met:

1. Shareholders: The shareholders must have no major criminal records in the past 3 years.
2. Founder: The founder must have no major criminal records in the past 3 years.
3. Minimum capital: The minimum capital required to establish an insurance agency company is CNY 5000 million.
4. Approval by China Insurance Regulatory Commission: The establishment of the company must be approved by the China Insurance Regulatory Commission.

These three points are actually quite stringent, and in summary, it means that a company needs to have the power to back up its claims, and the national regulatory authority, specifically the China Insurance Regulatory Commission, must give its approval. Additionally, the company's shareholders must have good behavior, and as a small insurance intermediary, the policyholder should not be overly suspicious of the insurance policy, as there are three gates to pass through, and not every insurance company can achieve this.
It's not bad at this point, it's worth relying on.

From an insurance product perspective: Little umbrella insurance is like a supermarket for insurance, many companies' star-rated insurance products are sold on this platform, such as the latest addition of Super Maria 5-star insurance, the insurance company and the insured party are all Taiwanese, Little Umbrella Insurance is just a third-party intermediary, so there's no need to question its reliability.

From the perspective of the fee model: The products of internet platforms are generally more expensive than those of offline businesses due to the lack of operating costs such as rental fees and labor costs. However, the flexible payment methods, such as monthly payments, can reduce the burden on policyholders and maximize the leveraging of insurance products.
This is very good.
Consider.

From a professional standpoint, this is particularly important because insurance is a highly specialized industry that requires a strong professional degree, and many internet product customers can purchase insurance themselves, which can lead to many misunderstandings and biases in health and career assessments. Non-insurance professionals may unconsciously add their subjective opinions when making claims, thinking they are healthy or meet the requirements, which can easily lead to hidden risks and potential rejection of claims.
I have previously worked as a insurance phone salesperson on the "Tencent Micro-Insurance" platform (which is similar to a micro-insurance agency), and I am very responsible in informing everyone.
The insurance of the internet is true and reliable, but the people are not, and the internet channels do not have professional sales staff, and there are many misleading sales directions.

"For example, the insurance premium is 1 yuan for every 600,000 yuan of assets, and the customer can receive a free insurance benefit of 600,000 yuan without any deductions. However, the marketing strategy is not without flaws. Although it seems attractive at first, the customer may not be aware that the premium will increase every month, ranging from a few hundred to 200 yuan, and they may end up paying more than they expected. Many customers have bought this insurance policy without fully understanding the terms and conditions."
"Thinking it could cost only 100,000 yuan, the insurance company paid out 600 million (a drop in the bucket)."
Free mobile phone delivery, the delivery code is like 6666 or 8888, and if you win the lottery, you don't need to exchange it and no one will remind you.

For the insured person, it's just another pitfall. Free coverage of 60,000 yuan for serious illnesses is temporary, and if you only rely on this, you won't be able to solve the problem completely. After the illness occurs, 60,000 yuan can't do anything to help, and your future life will be full of hardships.
Currently, the government is strictly cracking down on misleading information regarding online insurance sales.
Therefore, when considering the overall situation, the platform itself is without problems, the product is also without problems, the issue lies with the professionalism and work ethic of the staff.

It is recommended to carefully consider the overall situation, as many offline insurance brokerage companies have more diverse products, and customers have more opportunities and products to choose from, and some products have better quality than their online counterparts.
I have helped over 59 internet customers by providing after-sales service for their products, and the cost savings per person are around 2000-3000 yuan per year.
If anyone has any questions, please feel free to communicate and interact with me.

"I am a insurance agent with over 3 years of experience in enterprise management training. I have served over 1,000 corporate clients and collaborated with over 100 insurance companies. Before making a purchase, I will listen to the needs of my clients and customize insurance products for them. During the purchase process, I will strive to secure the best possible insurance results for my clients. After the purchase, I will handle the insurance claims and ensure that my clients are at ease."
"Grow with each customer for a lifetime."
Hope my answer can help you out!

According to the definition of the insurance regulatory department, internet insurance refers to the insurance business where the policyholder can complete all the insurance procedures after clicking the insurance link.
The policyholder does not need to sign, nor does the insurance consultant. All steps can be completed autonomously by the policyholder.

Although the insurance policy of the internet has no "ceremonial feel" to it, nor does it even have a paper contract, this does not affect the validity and legal effectiveness of the electronic contract.
This pattern is similar to a "flowchart"-like workflow for selling telephones, but purchasing insurance may have a fatal flaw - the subsequent service may not be able to keep up.

Insurance is typically a long-term contract that lasts for several decades, when purchasing insurance, shouldn't we carefully think about the "middleman" we choose, who will be able to accompany us for a long time and provide services to us in the future?

Vietnamese People's Newspaper - Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh attends the third Vietnam National Digital Technology Enterprise Development Forum.

During the third Vietnam Digital Technology Enterprise Development Forum, two main conferences were held to discuss topics surrounding digital technology enterprises and the country's digital transformation, as well as the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on digital technology enterprises and the post-pandemic economic recovery and development.

The head of the Communications and Information Technology Department, Nguyen Mong Son, said that in 2021, although the COVID-19 epidemic continued to spread, the number of digital technology companies in Vietnam and their revenue still maintained a growth trend, with an increase of nearly 10%.

In 2021, Vietnam saw a surge in the number of digital products, which helped to address various challenges faced by the country, and many digital products have already been exported, resulting in a rise in Vietnam's digital technology ranking.

The vice-mayor of Renmen Huang urged digital technology enterprises to take on the responsibility of developing the country's digital transformation platform, and the task of developing these platforms is a matter of national mission.

On the forum, various departments and government agencies, as well as leaders of digital technology companies, organizations, and individuals, are actively studying, developing, applying, and transferring digital technologies to mobilize and gather the resources of the entire society to develop Vietnamese technology enterprises, drive the digital transformation of the country, and find innovative solutions to overcome the challenges after the COVID-19 pandemic, such as economic recovery.
Premier Wen Jiabao emphasized in his speech that digitalization is an inevitable path for the world and a necessary condition for development.
Digital transformation has become a global issue, and digital transformation services benefit all citizens, therefore, we need to mobilize all citizens to participate.
The people and enterprises are the core, main body, target, and driving force of digital transformation.
Therefore, all policies must be for the people and businesses.

Premier Wen Jiabao emphasized that the digital transformation needs to embody the spirit of the nation, with the internal strength as the main force, strategic, long-term, and decisive factors, while external forces are important and breakthroughs.

He believed that digital transformation needs to drive the development towards deeper and more sustainable growth, participating in the control of the COVID-19 pandemic, economic recovery, and development, as well as adapting to changes after the pandemic, overcoming the problem of resource depletion, and assisting in green transformation and the development of green energy.

Digital transformation needs to participate in protecting and promoting the cultural values, historical traditions, national feelings, and related database establishment work, driving the digitalization of banks, taxation, land management, and logistics industries.
The ultimate goal of digital transformation is to make the people happier and the country more prosperous.

Premier Fan Mingxian requires that each level of government, each department, and each enterprise must increase their leadership and guidance in developing digital technologies, enhance their understanding of digital transformation, continue to formulate and perfect policies related to digital transformation, and strengthen the country's management and promote the development of digital technology enterprises with a spirit of respect, communication, listening, proactivity, and initiative.
During the forum, Premier Zhang Ming attended the 2021 "Vietnam Digital Products Excellence Award Ceremony" and the "Vietnam Digital Products Closing Ceremony."

"Shanghai International Rail Transport and Equipment Manufacturing Talent Summit 2021 Opening - Rolling News - Hunan Daily Net - Hua Shang Online"

Note: "Shanghai" should be written as "Shanghai" in English, not "Shanghai" (with a space).

The article from Hunan Daily on December 10th (Full Media Reporter Zhou Bing): The "Smart Rail Shenzhou" 2021 China International Rail Transit and Equipment Manufacturing Industry Talent Summit opened in Changsha on the 9th.
The provincial committee's standing committee, Wang Cheng, attended the launch ceremony and gave a speech.

Wang Zhen pointed out that organizing the talent peak forum is an important measure to implement the spirit of the Central Talent Work Conference and the 12th Provincial Party Congress, and it has demonstrated Hunan's sincerity and determination to value, seek, and make good use of talents.

Hunan has a rich tradition of fostering talents, providing a broad platform for talent development, and creating a favorable environment for realizing a beautiful life. In recent years, the province has deeply implemented a talent development strategy, with the "Florence Plan" serving as a driving force, establishing a comprehensive talent development framework for the entire talent chain, and becoming a fertile soil for talent growth, an incubator for innovation and entrepreneurship, and a pleasant land for living and working.

At present, Hunan is comprehensively implementing the "Three Highs and Four New" strategy and mission tasks, which aims to further expand the talent pool and provide better conditions for outstanding talents to thrive, thereby creating more excellent policies, concentrating more resources, and creating better conditions for outstanding talents to start their businesses, and we expect outstanding talents from all sectors to join forces to promote high-quality development in Hunan.

The following settings have been made at the venue: the Exhibition Hall of Longshan, the Exhibition Hall of Changsha, the Exhibition Hall of Hengyang, and the Exhibition Hall of Hunan Province. The Science and Technology Bureau, the Industry and Information Technology Bureau, and the Human Resources and Social Bureau have released the list of advanced manufacturing-related technological innovation priorities, the smart manufacturing industry talent demand catalog, and the doctoral youth talent demand catalog for the smart manufacturing industry.

Forty-eight large enterprises in China, including Changan Automobile, Chongqing Rail Transit, and Yuan Cheng Technology, have participated in the on-the-job training project for talents, involving nearly a thousand graduates and professionals from various fields.

The Yangtze River Basin achieves comprehensive green water coverage - Xinhua Net.

According to Xinhua News Agency on December 11th, the Chongqing Rongli Waterfront Green Comprehensive Service Area in Chongqing was completed and put into operation on the 10th, following the successful operation of the Yibin Waterfront Green Comprehensive Service Area in Sichuan Province, which was officially put into operation on the 8th, marking the second waterfront green comprehensive service area on the upper reaches of the Yangtze River to be put into operation.
To this extent, the green comprehensive service area on the Longjiang River has been covered from upstream, middle stream, and downstream.

The Director of the Transportation and Navigation Bureau of the Ministry of Transport, Cui Runtian, introduced that before, the provinces of Hubei, Hunan, Jiangxi, Anhui, and Jiangsu along the Yangtze River have established 10 green comprehensive service areas in the middle and lower reaches of the river, which have been well received by the vast majority of ship crew members and have played an important role in promoting the high-quality development of Yangtze River navigation.

The comprehensive green service area covering the entire length of the Yangtze River is another milestone event in the green navigation construction of the Yangtze River, with significant improvement in the reception of ship pollutants and navigation service capabilities.
According to the introduction, the waterfront comprehensive service area provides comprehensive services for large vessels, crew members, and helps solve the "urgent problems" of the crew.

This time, the two water-based comprehensive service areas on the upstream of the Yangtze River have been successfully launched, integrating life services, production services, and government services into a whole, with green environmental protection as the theme and ship repair and emergency rescue services as their unique features. This will enable ship workers who regularly navigate the Yangtze River to work more efficiently and live more conveniently.

"Just had a chat with friends about Meta's recent stock drop of 26%, with a market value evaporating by $2510 billion. Zuckerberg responded with 'facing unprecedented competition' as the reason. Why is that?"

Meta (formerly Facebook) is essentially a advertising company, with the majority of its income coming from advertising. Today, the most profitable advertising companies are those that have their own traffic channels.
Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and other functions, regardless of their positioning, are all traffic channels of Meta.
Not only that, Meta is also the largest "ad alliance", many Apps externalize their ads through Meta's advertising platform, and achieve transformation through Meta.
However, the times have changed.
Due to the adjustment of Apple's privacy policy, Meta has found it difficult to obtain user data information, which has affected the efficiency of advertisement delivery.
Apple's current privacy policy is very user-friendly, and it will clearly prompt users whether they allow the app to access their personal information. Most people's normal reaction is to decline.
If Google were to strike again, the impact on Meta's income would be even greater.
The second factor is that the China component of Meta's revenue growth has weakened (the weight of this factor is uncertain but exists).
Everyone knows that Meta is not doing business in China, but this understanding is not accurate.
At least 10% of Meta's income comes from China, mainly from companies in the seafood industry.
Approximately several hundred people work in Meta's office in Hong Kong, and there are several large agents on the mainland.
The Chinese company wants to expand its overseas market, but Meta (Facebook) is an unavoidable advertising channel, and most of the money is spent on Meta.
It's interesting, now ByteDance's TT is one of Meta's main competitors, but in the past two years, Meta has made a significant amount of money from ByteDance.
Each domestic agent in China is helping to spread ads on Meta, and Meta's performance in the Greater China region is also quite impressive.
I haven't specifically looked into it recently, but I'm sure it won't be better than before.
The stage of large-scale money burning by Chinese companies abroad has passed.
Thirdly, the new water channel expansion is not smooth.
Facebook is getting older, and new platforms like TT are not under Meta's control.
The biggest problem is not just a decline in income, but a lack of growth expectations.
The capital market is not just looking at current income, but more importantly, it is looking at the expected future.
It is obvious that Meta's expectations are not enough.
To tell a new story to the market, Zuckerberg spoke of "Metaverse".

Universe (元宇宙) should be one of the directions for the future, but the implementation period of Universe is relatively long, and this story should not be able to support Meta's value for the next two to three years.
Therefore, the next two years will be a more difficult period for Meta.

Don't look at the current flashy appearance of Facebook, with annual revenues of 10 billion to 20 billion US dollars. In reality, Facebook is currently feeling quite vulnerable and lacks a solid safety net compared to other internet companies and high-tech firms.

Although his several social software have a higher daily active user rate compared to Facebook and WhatsApp, facing the rapid development of TikTok, he doesn't have much confidence in his own abilities and is just scratching his head.

The concept of "元宇宙" (or "metaverse") is a difficult and unreachable goal, with no hope of success within a short time frame, which is why Facebook is so dangerous, and why Zuckerberg keeps changing companies and searching for new paths, but I think his path is wrong, it's like a one-way street. Here are some of my thoughts for reference.
Article 17: The state implements a registration system for fire engineers' qualifications.

Personnel who have obtained the qualification certificates of the first-class and second-class registered fire engineers from the registration authority can be registered as fire engineers in their corresponding grades.
Article 18: The Public Security Bureau Fire Department is a registered certification body for the qualification of fire engineers.

The provincial, autonomous region, and municipal public security authorities' firefighting organizations serve as the registration examination departments for second-level registered fire engineers, and are responsible for the initial review of the registration work for first-level registered fire engineers.

Article 19: Persons who have obtained the qualification certificate for the first-class or second-class fire engineer and apply for registration shall be employed by a fire technical service organization or fire safety key unit that has been approved by the authorities, and shall submit the registration application materials to the fire authorities in the location where the employing unit is situated (if the employing unit is a company, the registration materials shall be submitted to the registration authority in the location where the company is situated).

Article 20: After receiving the registration application materials from the applicant, the public security organs of provinces, autonomous regions, and direct-controlled municipalities shall notify the applicant of any incomplete or non-compliant materials within 5 working days, and the applicant shall make the necessary corrections within the specified time. If the deadline is exceeded, the organ shall not be responsible for informing the applicant. From the date the application materials are received, the organ shall be deemed to have accepted them if no notification of non-compliance is made.

Both registered and unregistered applications for emergency response should be accompanied by a written certificate issued by the relevant public security fire agency, bearing the official seal and the date of notice.

Article 21: Within 20 working days after the date of self-reporting registration application by public security organs, fire departments at the provincial, autonomous region, and municipal levels shall complete the initial review of the registration application materials for the first-level registered fire engineer qualification and the registration review of the second-level registered fire engineer qualification, and shall report the results to the public security organs for approval.

The public security fire department should make a decision on whether to approve the application within 20 working days from the day it receives the application materials and initial examination opinions from the provincial public security department.
Within the specified timeframe, decisions cannot be made without approval, and the extension of the deadline and the reasons for it should be notified to the applicant.
The person who does not give their approval should provide written explanations of the reasons and inform the applicant of their right to file an administrative appeal or initiate legal proceedings.

Article 22: The registration review department should make a decision on approval within 10 working days from the date of approval, and issue and send the corresponding registration certificate to the appropriate level.
Article 23: Each registration of the certificate is valid for 3 years.

The registration certificate is within the valid period, which is the practicing license of the registered fire engineer of the appropriate level, and is managed and used by the registered fire engineer themselves.

Article 24: Applicants for initial registration shall obtain the qualification certificate of the first-level and second-level fire engineer within one year from the date of obtaining the qualification certificate.
Overdue application for initial registration must comply with the continuing education requirements.
The specific methods for registering, continuing registration, changing registration, canceling registration, and not registering, as stipulated by the public security department, are as follows.
Article 25: Continuing education is a necessary condition for the registration, re-registration, and late registration of certified fire engineers.
Each level of registered fire safety engineer should complete the corresponding continuing education according to the regulations during the validity period of their registration.

Article 26: The registration and approval department should promptly notify the public of the registration information of fire engineers and establish a credit file for them, and implement credit management for their professional activities.

Article 27: The registration management department of each level of registered fire engineering technicians should strictly implement the relevant provisions of the Administrative Permit Law of the People's Republic of China.

"Peaceful Rescue-2021" Joint Drill Concludes Successfully - Xinhua Net

December 12th, 2021, all members of the Chinese delegation participating in the "Peaceful Rescue-2021" joint exercise with the Vietnamese military safely returned to the Chinese border region, marking the successful completion of the 7-day training mission.

This joint exercise surrounded the humanitarian medical relief issue, with the two armies tightly focusing on their rescue and relief missions, and completing the training content of joint command, joint rescue, and mass casualty handling according to realistic standards, effectively enhancing the joint medical security capabilities of the two armies.
The training results have been recognized by both the Chinese and Vietnamese militaries.

The chairman of the joint training guidance committee, Mr. Nguyen Xuan Son, said at the conclusion of the exercise that through this training, Vietnamese medical personnel had learned about the organization and professional activities of Chinese medical personnel, as well as the medical equipment and safety measures used by the Chinese military.
The results of the drill demonstrate the professional capabilities of both countries in medical assistance and epidemic prevention.

Chen Spring, the deputy director of the Medical Affairs Bureau of the Central Military Commission, said that this exercise is a new breakthrough in innovative practice based on the successful holding of the joint medical rescue exercise in 2018, and has very important symbolic significance.

During the training period, the Chinese People's Liberation Army donated medical protective masks, medical protective clothing, and rapid nucleic acid detection equipment to the Vietnamese People's Army.
